intro: Mystroxylon nyasicum, commonly known as the Nyasi mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
